name: Martha
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
October 2023
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
This is a perfect place to stay if you have kids at EOU or traveling through! Far enough from the train tracks that we didn't hear a thing.
The layout doesn't feel like a studio - there are defined separate areas for the kitchen, living, and sleeping. For example, the king-size bed is partially walled off from the living/kitchen & there is plenty of room between the well-equipped kitchen and living room. The kitchen even has full-size appliances. The washing machine/dryer combo was very cool. I now want one at my house :-)
The place is adorable and the bedding is AMAZING!
One thing of note - if you have a longer vehicle, park on the street (there were plenty of spaces). If you have a smaller car you will do fine in the assigned parking spot.

There was a storm that night while we were sleeping and it caused the pump to shut down. We called our house up and they had it repaired within an hour. We were still able to get in our morning soak without being inconvenienced in any way. We would definitely recommend anyone who's willing to go out of the way to come to this place and enjoy it as much as we have. We plan on coming back here as often as we possibly can.

review_text:
I will be returning often. So peaceful! The winter season has lots of availability; in my opinion thatâ€™s the best time to go to hot springs in general. There is so much fascinating history in this area. This location is really close the ominous Hot Lake Hotel. I love historical buildings; this one did not disappoint. The Yurt #2 that we stayed in has the perfect tub for 1 to 2 couples. I would not recommend more than 4 adults as the yurt is small and cozy. It was perfect for us! We went with one other couple and we had such a sweet time. Really clean and beautiful! I highly recommend the Yurts with private tubs! I really look forward to our next visit.
*no kitchen; we brought veggie platters, crackers and dips. There is a gas grill and we did bring beyond burgers. We forgot a cutting board, plates etc., so we skipped it. No biggie for us at all! Iâ€™m only mentioning it so if you do want to use the grill, make sure you bring plates etc.
5 STARS!

Something that would really enhance the space would be an outdoor shower (like yurt 1 has) or even a spigot so one can rinse off before or after soaking, or even wash hands. That would keep the tub cleaner too cus then people wouldnâ€™t just get into the tub with their unshowered bodies. Noticed a lot of dead skin in the tub as i was filling it for the first time. review_text: We stayed here for three nights and left feeling relaxed and rejuvenated. The grounds are peaceful and pristinely kept, the bathrooms are the cleanest I have ever seen in any place of this type, and the yurt was comfy and cozy! We used the private tub at least twice a day and especially enjoyed the tub at night - under the stars and watching the fire from the fire pit. Absolutely beautiful. The staff were also quite lovely and helpful. The nearby town of Cove has an awesome steakhouse (and a beautiful drive getting there!) and La Grande is super fun for exploring! Lots of fun antique / thrift stores, bookstores, cute places to get coffee. We went to The Smokehouse twice for some of the best breakfast weâ€™ve ever had. Just a lovely stay all the way around. We look forward to returning! Thank you!

Stayed with kids
review_text:
Yurt life is the good life! We loved our stay at Yurt 2 and would recommend the RV park and the Yurt to cozy friends or small families. It was comfortable for a couple nights but not a lot of room to spread out - definitely not a good place for working, but a GREAT place for relaxing!
The yurt has a bunk bed with full/queen bottom bunk and a twin top bunk; there's also a futon but if you were using that for sleeping there's no other indoor space, which might be necessary for rainy days. Inside there's a mini fridge, coffee maker and all the fixins for a great coffee or tea - in fact, the coffee provided by the Resort is INCREDIBLE.
The back terrace feels pretty private - but there is a nature trail that passes just beyond, which can get active. You are private if sitting in the hot tub but be aware when you stand up!
The hot tub was awesome. Fed by the hot spring, it was extremely hot. The toilets and showers are a short walk away, sparkling clean. Excellent stay!

This was the perfect spot to meet up with our family before heading to Joseph, OR. This was the first time we stayed in a yurt. The beds were comfortable, and the private outdoor sitting/dining/grill/hot tub (which guests fill with water from the hot spring) was fantastic. We enjoyed a nice soak under the stars and again in the morning before departing.
All the facilities were clean, and the people were friendly. Union (a quaint town) and LaGrande are nearby. Bonus, there was a Tesla charger onsite allowing us to top off at no additional charge before heading to Joseph, OR.
Many thanks for a great stay. We will be back.

The private yurt was so lovely and cozy! We fit 4 folks and were comfortable. The soaking tub in the back is fed with geothermal water, fills up in maybe 15-20minutes. Make sure to read instructions as the hot water is very hot!
The area is beautiful. Easy to add on a trip to Joseph / Wallowa mountains for the day. It can get windy though, cold in winter, and I'm sure in the summer hot. The yurt stayed warm, and there was an air conditioner.
The beds were comfortable. Bedding and towels provided. Mini fridge and coffee maker provided. The back area had some high fencing to protect from wind and provided privacy. The grill was great to cook with and a burner on the side.
There is a view of the hill behind and sometimes hikers walked by, but that was ok. You do have to walk a little bit to bathrooms but they were squeaky clean. Staff was friendly, helpful. Highly recommend!

name: Megan
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
August 2022
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
My kids and I had an awesome time here! Usually I pack our trips full of activities, but this time around, everyone was perfectly content hanging out in the pools and the private tub on the back patio, and relaxing around the yurt and property. I have three children, a 16-year-old, an 8-year-old, and a 7-month-old, and itâ€™s sometimes tough to find activities that everyone enjoys. However, all three of them had a blast!
It was great that we didnâ€™t need to bring any linens or towels. And I brought my propane camping stove, but didnâ€™t need it because there was a burner on the propane barbecue provided on the back patio. That was super convenient.
Another feature we really liked was that the private tub had a cold spigot and a hot spigot. That way we could adjust the temperature as needed. We visited in the summer, when it was very hot. But we were able to adjust the temperature in the tub so that it was just right for the temperature outside. Then, in the evening, we could heat it up and relax in the cooler air.
We had complete privacy on the back patio, and a nice view of the hillside behind us. We were also very thankful for the air conditioning. It was in the high 90s when we were there, but as soon as we entered the yurt, it was a cool 72Â°.
The staff was super nice, and responded to my questions promptly. Overall, this was a great experience, and I recommend it for anyone!

,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text: My friend & I was visiting with a lady traveling to the poker tournament in Pendleton, who was soaking & not staying overnight. There was a couple in the hot springs, my friend & I sat in the lounge chairs while the traveler hung out in the pool by herself. The lady had asked if we knew what time it was. Just then, an employee came out dipped a container into the water and said "It's 5 o'clock & time to get out," which she did. My friend & I thought it was very impolite how the employee handled the soaking guest, being the only person in the pool & announcing it for everyone there to hear. She should have leaned in quietly & said something. I actually felt embarrassment for her, and the employee who lacked the manners to deal with the situation tactfully. At 10pm that same night we walked to the bathhouse & there were 3 people still in the hot water pools while several others stood outside the pool. You should enforce rules to Everyone.

The outdoor space was so magical with the fire pit and string lights. Clean and very well maintained. The yurt itself was clean, cozy, and warm. The fridge and coffee maker was nice to have. The bathrooms were in a different building, but we knew that because the description was spot on. What we didn't know was that the bathrooms/showers would be so nice! Clean, warm, and well laid out. The only downside was that the train seemed pretty close to the property, which was loud, but not too disruptive. We visited for only one night in March, and the RV park was pretty empty, but I'm sure it would be full during the summer months.

review_text: What an amazing little gem this lovely yurt is with its private and perfectly appointed back patio. The yurt itself was a perfect 74 degrees inside (geothermally heatedâ€”including the floor!) even though our stay was in early December with morning temps outside in the teens. The only amenity I wished was included was a microwave, but seriously, everything else that WAS there made this glamping experience the best ever. The restroom is a super short walk away, and it, too, was warm, clean, and welcoming. That all saidâ€¦ we enjoyed the hot-spring tubs on the back patio multiple times, including the morning before we left. The stars above showed bright, and a hoot owl serenaded us from a nearby tree. We did experience an extra roommate (a frog!) for a while, but we only heard him and never did see him. Not certain if he was inside or out, but he quieted down when we banged on the wall. Bottom line, weâ€™ll definitely stay in Yurt #1 again when weâ€™re traveling through La Grande. Two thumbs up!

Bring extra towels and earplugs (canvas walls) and don't forget to check out all the great local places to grab food and drinks.

We camp at this location 2-3 times a year just for a quick get out of the house weekend. The kids enjoy it and it's very easy to get in and out. My wife and I have stayed in yurt 1 a few times over the past few years. It's always a very reminiscent place for us. It's the break we need from life without too much travel or hassle. Even for one night. The bathrooms are always very nice and clean. The owners and staff are always very nice and helpful. I know they have a lot of irons in the fire right now. But I wish they would put up more of these rooms like the yurts. The word is out and it has become very difficult to get a booking. Plan way ahead.
We also visited the hotel next-door. We hope to stay there soon too. Ryan in the pub was great.

My family and I had an amazing stay and cannot wait to go back. All of the staff were welcoming, friendly, and helpful, including Rocky, the cat. The hot spring facilities were clean and peaceful. We were also pleasantly surprised by the historical beauty of the building, free movie showing and tasty food at the pub.
I would recommend this experience to anyone looking for a unique place to visit and stay. For selfish reasons I hope the Lodge keeps itâ€™s character and doesnâ€™t get too commercialized.

name: Erica
rating_info:

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Will definitely go again! We were warned about wind, but mother nature had other plans... no wind, which made the mosquitoes come out in full force! Yikes! The building is exactly as described although maybe even more charming. The building is VERY warm on sunny days. Make sure your room radiator is turned off asap or you will have a hot night despite outdoor temps below 40. The window screens have to be put in and out for use - they're not permanently installed. That felt a little awkward considering I could climb out my window and over to another room very easily. Provided fans should fit the windows better and instructions on how to use the ceiling fan and radiator should be more clear. 1st night "slept" hot and was grateful for morning, 2nd night had it figured out and slept wonderfully. I heard the train when I was awake but it was not loud enough to wake me from sleep. It will be fun to return and see how they continue to improve this historic gem!

We really enjoyed our time at Hot Lake. I see so much potential for property and have so many ideas for them! I hope they eventually build a culinary destination restaurant so you donâ€™t have to leave at all. They have great outdoor seating for it in summertime. The thermal pub is great for a snack.
I enjoyed soaking every day and appreciated that day users have to leave by 8 PM. All the people who were tipsy and rowdy mostly left at a reasonable time when staff asked them to.
The breakfast offerings were great for a light breakfast. My only suggestion is to serve it at the half moon bar in the lobby area adjacent to the Thermal Pub so it doesnâ€™t get too congested.
We will be back!

Stayed one night
review_text: The place is a timecapsule; full of history. It's genuinely peaceful. There are a thousand little details that show thoughtful consideration of design (modernized) and usability within the building. Terry cloth robes and spa like atmosphere in personal bathroom. Extremeyly friendly and helpful staff. The pools are just outside the building, not a long walk which was nice. There are: cubbies for your things and hooks to hang towels, etc.; a privace fense from the hotel; shaded spaces if you need to escape the sun; beautiful fire pits when it gets dark; posted temperatures of each pool/tub hourly; and a resident cat named Rocky. There is a bar with appertizer options. Not much for breakfast aside from a few pieces of fruit, granola bars, and coffee. I wish we didn't have to leave the property to have meals but you can bring food. There is a fridge provided for guest use with a dinning area. Town is about 8 miles away. Over all a wonderful stay and we'll be back. Thank you!!

This is a lovely spot in a very cool old hotel. They are renovating but were clear about that up front and what was being done was quite unobtrusive. The rooms, restaurant, spas, sun rooms and public spaces were all great. The local-made bagels for breakfast were super.
They had personal robes for each guest to walking to and from the tub area was easy and comfortable.
I like the idea of a movie night, available Thu-Sun.
Staff were all very friendly, informative and responsive. The food in the restaurant, although a limited menu, was good and reasonably priced.
There is not much hiking on the property but nearby are several parks - Catherine Creek State Park, Morgan Lake Park, and more that have nice hikes. La Grande has some good restaurants.

review_text:
This is a return visit so the Lodge has its charms. We understand they are working to get the restaurant remodeled & working 7 days a week, ditto the movie theater. It is a bit inconvenient to drive back into LaGrande (Monday-Thursday ) for supplies or dinner.
The room we stayed in had a small fridge & microwave so that helped the situation. We wish the lodge had soaking tubs exclusively for lodge guests; as it is, the RV park gets to use the tubs, too, and can seem crowded until 8 pm, when lodge guests are the only designated users. Tubs exclusive to lodge guests WOULD BE A HUGE PLUS.
With â€œsoftâ€ check-ins available (use of soaking tubs until 4 pm check-in), it is a tiny bit better than NO EARLY CHECK-INS, but my friend and I did not want to wear wet suits for long after soakingâ€¦so we opted to take a 2 hr drive instead.
In all, the Hot Lakes Lodge has nothing but great potential and it is NICE to see an old, historic building with many past lives coming back to life in this way.

The staff was super friendly and accommodating. We two teenage kids were comfortable and enjoyed soaking. I'm looking forward to watching the property evolve over the next few years and will definitely be making return trips!

This is a plunge into the past. A venerable sanatorium that reached its peak in the first half of the century, almost fell down and has just recently been saved.
The hot pools are delightful, the staff very pleasant and the setting quite beautiful and haunting.
If you are willing to spend some extra money, Suite 217 is spacious and charming. No restaurant, but tasty light food, beer, wine and cider available at the bar.

review_text:
Iâ€™m guessing on everything because we didnâ€™t actually get to make this trip, so Iâ€™ve given them 5 stars on everything except accuracy.
A few days before we visited, the host changed their policy and began to allow day guests at the hot springs. We only found this out through Instagram, no one notified us of the change. I messaged for more information and while the host was responsive, their strategy was disappointing- no official cap on the number of day passes, theyâ€™re just playing it by ear. With the pandemic numbers way up right now, we couldnâ€™t justify a trip not knowing how crowded the pools would be, so we had to cancel.
This place looks beautiful in the photos and hopefully we can visit someday. For now, I wish the host would be more proactive about sharing changes like this with booked guests so they have all the info they need to make decisions. It would also be nice if they had a more generous cancellation policy, especially if theyâ€™re going to change things last minute and make you choose between feeling safe and losing your money.

The next morning the wind was roaring off the hill and even our hydro flasks had to be propped next to the tub to not blow away. I highly recommend you visit.

THIS PLACE IS INCREDIBLE. First up: this charming room is so spacious, with two large bedrooms, one with a desk, separated by a lovely sitting room with an electric fireplace and a large bathroom with a long clawfoot tub. The style of the room is so thoughtful and lovely! Good to note, there is a microwave and a small fridge in the room.
And the hot pools: AMAZING. We had cloud cover, so we couldn't see stars, but the full moon was on full display. The steam rising off Hot Lake creates a wonderful atmosphere.
The overall property is this wonderful blend of historic charm and modern simplicity, and there is plenty of places to have a meeting, read a book, or relax outside of your room. I can't wait until the pub is open.

name: Nate
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

review_text:
Like stepping back in time to stay at a rustic early-1900s hotel on the Western frontier, only with added modern comforts. Imagine our surprise after using a physical key to open up our suite (Room 217, two bedrooms), only to find a remote-controlled fireplace by the couch in the middle common room! Along with WiFi, this was perfect for finishing a cozy evening watching a western on my laptop after a long soak out on the lakeside deck.
The hot pools do not close at night and were consistently at a perfect temperature of just over 105Â° (with very minor temperature fluctuations at night) and temp-checked by staff every hour. The tubs' view of the hills, steaming lake, ducks, and sunset were unforgettable. We will be back and can't wait to see what other amenities (theater? on-site kitchen or restaurant?) may eventually be added & opened to guests!
But even before any of those renovations are completed, you won't be disappointed by what they offer now: daily delivery of custom dinner orders (from Side A Brewing) and MANY on-site drink options: beer, cider, wine, hard seltzers, etc. Family-friendly, respectful and relaxing atmosphere. Treat yourself to a night or two at this mini-vacation destination that you'll never forget!

review_text:
Donâ€™t let your first impression ruin your experience here.
Once inside this cute, well equipped basement suite, you will soon forget the difficulty of trying to park while avoiding the neighbors scrap wood pile and that you had to dodge free range chicken manure in the lawn to avoid tracking it into the house (which discouraged us from wanting to use the hot tub).
This cozy and nicely decorated shared space provides everything you will need for your stay. The coffee is great, internet is fast, and the bed is comfortable.
Monica has helpful signs throughout the unit to provide clear instructions including the â€œwatch your headâ€ sign, as the short ceilings may be an issue for taller travelers.
The hosts live upstairs and do their best to keep the expected overhead noise at a minimum for those of us who retire early.

review_text: This airbnb is of exceptional quality and value. Five adults shared a weekend here and we could not have been more pleased with the accommodations. While the neighborhood is not something to write home about, the house is within walking distance from town, which was important to us. The house is exceptional. The vaulted ceiling of the living room (and dining area) gave such a feeling of spaciousness while the fireplace added coziness. The quality of the furnishings is outstanding, and every inch of the house is tastefully decorated; one has the sense that it was a labor of love for Sarah. We came to ski at Anthony Lakes and appreciated that we could store our gear on the back porch out of our way. The kitchen gave a whole new meaning to "well-stocked"; there is even an ice cream scoop! We lacked for nothing. From bed linens to bathroom rugs, the aesthetics and quality gives one a pampered feel. We loved staying here!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
What a wonderful experience and just the home away from home that I needed for the week I was in town.
Heather's place not only had everything you will need to feel right at home (really appreciated the multiple options for making coffee), but was also super trendy, stylish, and CLEAN. The master suite, including king bed, walk in closet/seating area, and bathroom was on par with a 5 star resort!
Heather's communication was quick, friendly, and very accommodating. The location can not be beat...a couple blocks to downtown, a couple blocks to Eastern Oregon University, and 10 minutes to Morgan Lake.
Fingers crossed I will be able to stay at Heather's place next time I'm in town! Cheers!

review_text: Apt 101 is a spacious two bedroom, two bathroom unit with all the modern amenities of home, which makes it a very comfortable place to stay. There are two large TVs with several movie channels, like NETFLIX, one in the living room and the other in the master bedroom. The kitchen is fully furnished with all the essentials for preparing and serving meals if you plan to cook. Also, there is a combined washer/dryer in the unit. Everything was immaculately clean. And finally, the location is very convenient for easy walking to downtown or strolls through quiet neighborhoods.
